verses.text: 約伯回答說：
「像這樣的話，我聽了很多；你們都是叫人愁煩的安慰者。
虛空的言語，有窮盡嗎？或有甚麼惹你答個不休的呢？

words.note: Often used in philosophical/religious contexts, e.g., Ecclesiastes.
Functions here to connect verb with descriptive phrase.

verses.text: 你們若處在我的景況，我也能像你們那樣說話，我也能砌辭攻擊你們，並且能向你們搖頭。

words.definition: to fabricate words, make up excuses

words.note: A verb-object compound.

verses.text: 我能用口鼓勵你們，我嘴唇的安慰，能緩和你們的痛苦。
我若說話，痛苦仍不消解，我若閉口不說，痛苦也不離開我。

words.note: More formal than 如果
Lit. 'speak words'
More formal than 消除 (xiāochú)
More formal than 如果

verses.heading: Abandonment by God and Man

verses.text: 現在 神使我困倦，『你蹂躪了我的全家，

words.note: Refers to the singular, supreme God.
Often found in literary or religious texts.

verses.text: 又把我捆綁起來。』這就作為證據；我身體的枯瘦也當面作證反對我。

words.note: Introduces object before verb.
Often used in spiritual or historical contexts.
Used with verbs to indicate an action's start or result.

verses.text: 他的怒氣撕裂我，攻擊我；他向我咬牙切齒，我的敵人以銳利的眼光看著我。

words.note: More formal than 生氣 (shēngqì).

words.definition: gnash teeth, grit teeth in anger
words.note: An idiom describing extreme anger or hatred.

verses.text: 他們向我大大張嘴，以蔑視的態度打我的臉頰，聯合一起攻擊我。

words.note: Reduplication of '大' (dà) to intensify meaning.

verses.text: 神把我交給不義的人，把我丟在惡人的手中。

words.note: Lit. 'not righteous'.
Lit. 'evil person'.

verses.text: 我本來安逸，他卻把我壓碎；掐著我的頸項，把我摔碎；又把我當作他的箭靶。
他的弓箭手四面包圍我，他剖開我的腰子，全不顧惜，把我的膽傾倒在地上。

words.note: Often refers to kidneys, symbolizing inner being/emotions.
Refers to gall, often associated with inner being.

verses.text: 他把我破傷，在破口上又加破傷，如勇士一般向我直衝。

words.note: Fig. also a breach or gap.
Lit. 'brave scholar/soldier'.

verses.text: 我把麻布縫在我的皮膚上，把我的角插入塵土中。

words.note: Associated with mourning or repentance.
Symbolizes strength, dignity, or power.

verses.text: 我的臉因哭泣而發紅，在我的眼皮上滿是黑影。
然而在我的手中沒有強暴，我的禱告也是清潔的。

words.note: Often used after a noun to indicate 'in/amongst'.
Commonly used in biblical contexts referring to oppression or violent acts.
Verb-object compound, often functions as a noun 'prayer' or verb 'to pray'.
Used after adjectives to form an adverbial phrase or link to a noun.

verses.text: 向 神哭訴地啊，不要遮蓋我的血；不要讓我的哀求有停留的地方。

words.note: A traditional Chinese reverence marker, similar to an honorific space.
Connects a verb/adjective to another verb, forming an adverbial phrase.
Connects verb/phrase to form a noun phrase, e.g., 'the place where X stays'.

verses.heading: An Appeal to God as Witness

verses.text: 現今，在天上有我的見證，在高天之上，有我的證人。

words.note: Often refers specifically to the dwelling place of God.
Can refer to a person (witness) or a statement (testimony), common in biblical language.
A poetic or archaic term for the highest heavens, often used in religious texts.
More formal or literary than '在...上'.
Specifically refers to a person who testifies or witnesses.

verses.text: 譏笑我的，就是我的朋友，我的眼向 神流淚。

words.note: Turns the preceding verb phrase into a noun phrase, e.g., 'those who mock me'.
A traditional Chinese reverence marker, similar to an honorific space.

verses.text: 但願人可以為人與 神分辯，正如世人為朋友辯白一樣。

words.note: The leading space is a traditional reverence marker for God.
To argue or plead one's case, often against someone.
To argue to make clear or to justify for someone.

verses.text: 因為我的年數將盡，我快要走上那條一去不返的路。」

breakdown.m: to want, to be going to

words.note: Used for long, thin objects like roads, rivers.
An idiom meaning to depart and never come back.
